extendedInfo.description: In its 27th year, Dragon Con will be held August 30 â September 2, 2013 in Atlanta, GA.  Dragon Con is the largest multi-media, popular culture convention focusing on science fiction and fantasy, gaming, comics, literature, art, music, and film in the universe!The Official Dragon Con 2013 Mobile App is your digital guide to all things Dragon Con, including viewing the convention schedule with close to 4000 hours of non-stop programming; checking out the stellar guest line up, including where to find them and a mini bio to get to know them a little better; browsing the dealers and exhibitors offering most anything you can imagine; and of course navigating the vast footprint of the show via handy dandy maps.  The Dragon Con App will be your best friend for Dragon Con 2013 (though our 56,000 attendees are pretty awesome).

reviews.title: Events
reviews.comment: I wonder if next app may allow us to automatically go to that current time\'s events.  On a Sunday afternoon, I don\'t want to page through Thursday thru Sat and then all the Sunday  morning events. Still a very useful app and look forward to 2014!!!
reviews.author: terry eyring

reviews.title: Very helpful
reviews.comment: This app was a lot of help during the con. The calendar was a cool feature, allowed me to organize my whole weekend. Thank you!
reviews.author: Stefan Peterson

reviews.title: Greatest Con Tool
reviews.comment: This app rocked! Kept my panals in order and helped me find where to go through the chaos.Those that complain they couldn\'t update during the con where in the data dapaners at the hotels. All they had to do was go outside and get a signal. ALL data was blocked,  not just this app which Thank God didn\'t need net access!
reviews.author: Philip Key

reviews.title: Sucked!
reviews.comment: No one could update during all of Dragon Con!
reviews.author: Adam Joyce

reviews.title: Galaxy 3
reviews.comment: Worked great. Loved all the new features and the time line on the schedule.
reviews.author: Meranda Sandlin

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.comment: This app worked for me but it was only good for the schedule.  The maps were useless and sometimes wouldn\'t load at all.  I wish that when you bookmarked something, it would pop up or something, but all in all it was very a very confusing first con.
reviews.author: Lena Pendleton

reviews.title: Last update killed the app
reviews.comment: Completely useless since this morning\'s update, cannot open any events to see their locations/details. Seems to only affect older Android revisions.
reviews.author: Ryan Tanay

reviews.comment: The app keeps crashing and takes several seconds to respond to each click if it decides to work. Sometimes it does not open up the event selected to give further info unless you star the event first.\tThe app keeps crashing and takes several seconds to respond to each click if it decides to work. Sometimes it does not open up the event selected to give further info unless you star the event first
reviews.author: Quynh Truong

reviews.title: Frustrating
reviews.comment: Highly frustrated by how many times the app crashes or fails to open. Updates are practically hourly
reviews.author: Leeza k

reviews.title: Good but...
reviews.comment: I love this app but I can\'t rate the events I went to. I want to give thoughts about what was great this year and what needed work.
reviews.author: lynn rainey

reviews.title: A pleasant surprise.
reviews.comment: The previous years apps have all been laughable but this one is not only a surprise compared to the last few but legitimately well done on its own. The time and effort definitely show.
reviews.author: Nick Bradley

reviews.title: Slow & prone to crashing
reviews.comment: Motorola DROID X2: -Useful tool with a poor execution.  -Regularly trying to download updates, and will crash upon cancelling the download.  -User interface is frustratingly slow. -Became completely unusable after updating it Sunday morning. Would crash when trying to view maps, events on my schedule, or the event listings. Fixed when updated in the afternoon.
reviews.author: Duncan Jenner

reviews.title: Better than nothing?
reviews.comment: Nobody I know had an easy time using this app this year, and this was my first year with the app and I had major disappointment. 1)Rotating my phone caused it to crash. 2)Clicking an event often caused it to crash. 3)It might actually be simpler to list the things that didn\'t cause it to crash: not using it. 4)Of course, crashiness was a problem when I was able to click on an event at all. Most of the time, I could see that the event existed, but the description and location wouldn\'t load on the first 5-10 clicks. Usually it would then crash and I\'d restart it.  Honestly, I don\'t care about the social networking part of the app. I want to be able to pull up my app and see when and where my next event is EASILY, and this wasn\'t the case.  Also, I don\'t want to be forced updates on opening the app EVERY time. Esp. in the middle of Con, I\'m trying to get around quickly and forcing the cancel eats valuable time (plus, it\'s not like there\'s much signal to work with during the event).  Finally: every time I opened the schedule I was reset to Thursday. If it\'s Sunday, I don\'t really care what was going on three days earlier, do I? I\'d much rather have it smart-start on the actual day.
reviews.author: Jennifer Stair

reviews.title: Good app, but sucks b/c of blockers on site.
reviews.comment: All the issues I\'ve had have been a result of the locations: the lack of free wifi at the hotels was VERY problematic.
reviews.author: Hannah Thompson

reviews.title: Better now
reviews.comment: Just updated again, and works much better. No more crashes or errors!
reviews.author: Jonathan Williams

reviews.title: Thanks for fixing the update
reviews.comment: I still can\'t rate panels, which is frustrating though.
reviews.author: Jen Cam

reviews.title: Hit or miss, but lots of potential.
reviews.comment: Terrific idea. If used to access schedule and some of the summaries, it worked. I hope the panel ratings and comments get to the Dragon officials.
reviews.author: Regenia Alcock

reviews.title: Good App This Year
reviews.comment: Though riddled with updates this year, it was necessary to keep up with the information. The app was very, very useful, and it was a big bonus that it worked offline due to the lack of signal the majority of the con.
reviews.author: Margaret Joiner

reviews.title: Instead of pouring money into your own app...
reviews.comment: That you\'re pushing critical updates (aside from content updates) to during the only weekend of use and with less than 24 hours left, why not use a widely used app like Guidebook to deliver content? App development seems less than rigorous if it\'s being updated during the only weekend of use and every year requires a new version.
reviews.author: Nigel Casantini

reviews.title: Barely usable
reviews.comment: App crashes every time.  I can use it to view events sorted by day only about half way down the list before crashing.
reviews.author: Nirodha Avidya
